title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 1, ch. III, subch. A, pt. 96 - General Seed Certification Standards
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 1, ch. III, subch. A, pt. 96 - General Seed Certification Standards

State Regulations
§ 96.1 - Definition of terms
§ 96.2 - Eligibility requirements for certification of crop varieties
§ 96.3 - Classes and sources of certified seed
§ 96.4 - Limitations of generations for certified seed
§ 96.5 - Production of all classes of certified seed
§ 96.6 - Processors and processing of all classes of certified seed
§ 96.7 - Labeling of all classes of certified seed
§ 96.8 - Requirements for training seed producers
§ 96.9 - Handling of crop prior to inspection
§ 96.10 - Establishing the source of seed
§ 96.11 - Qualifications for inspectors
§ 96.12 - Management and condition of field
§ 96.13 - Bulk certification
§ 96.14 - Seed failing to meet regular certification standards in respect to mechanical purity and/or germination
§ 96.15 - Complying with federal and state seed laws
§ 96.16 - Carry-over seed
§ 96.17 - Rejection of certification
§ 96.18 - Phyto-inspected seed
§ 96.19 - Advisory committee
§ 96.20 to 96.21 - Repealed

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 1, ch. III, subch. A, pt. 96

Statutory authority: Agriculture and Markets Law, §§141, 142

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
